1.verse: Parashat Bereshit Creation in Six Days - In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth.

2.verse: Now the earth was chaos and waste, darkness was on the surface of the deep, and the Ruach Elohim was hovering upon the surface of the water.

3.verse: Then God said, “Let there be light!” and there was light.

4.verse: God saw that the light was good. So God distinguished the light from the darkness.

5.verse: God called the light “day,” and the darkness He called “night.” So there was evening and there was morning—one day.

6.verse: Then God said, “Let there be an expanse in the midst of the water! Let it be for separating water from water.”

7.verse: So God made the expanse and it separated the water that was below the expanse from the water that was over the expanse. And it happened so.

8.verse: God called the expanse “sky.” So there was evening and there was morning—a second day.

9.verse: Then God said, “Let the water below the sky be gathered to one place. Let the dry ground appear.” And it happened so.

10.verse: God called the dry ground “land,” and the collection of the water He called “seas.” And God saw that it was good.

11.verse: Then God said, “Let the land sprout grass, green plants yielding seed, fruit trees making fruit, each according to its species with seed in it, upon the land.” And it happened so.

12.verse: The land brought forth grass, green plants yielding seed, each according to its species, and trees making fruit with the seed in it, each according to its species. And God saw that it was good.

13.verse: So there was evening and there was morning—a third day.

14.verse: Then God said, “Let lights in the expanse of the sky be for separating the day from the night. They will be for signs and for seasons and for days and years.

15.verse: They will be for lights in the expanse of the sky to shine upon the land.” And it happened so.

16.verse: Then God made the two great lights—the greater light for dominion over the day, and the lesser light as well as the stars for dominion over the night.

17.verse: God set them in the expanse of the sky to shine on the land

18.verse: and to have dominion over the day and over the night and to separate the light from the darkness. And God saw that it was good.

19.verse: So there was evening and there was morning—a fourth day.

20.verse: Then God said, “Let the waters swarm with swarms of living creatures! Let flying creatures fly above the land across the expanse of the sky.”

21.verse: Then God created the large sea creatures and every living creature that crawls, with which the water swarms, according to their species, as well as every winged flying creature, according to their species. And God saw that it was good.

22.verse: Then God blessed them by saying, “Be fruitful and multiply and fill the water in the seas. Let the flying creatures multiply on the land.”

23.verse: So there was evening and there was morning—a fifth day.

24.verse: Then God said, “Let the land bring forth living creatures according to their species—livestock, crawling creatures and wild animals, according to their species.” And it happened so.

25.verse: God made the wild animals according to their species, the livestock according to their species, and everything that crawls on the ground, each according to its species. And God saw that it was good.

26.verse: Then God said, “Let Us make man in Our image, after Our likeness! Let them rule over the fish of the sea, over the flying creatures of the sky, over the livestock, over the whole earth, and over every crawling creature that crawls on the land.”

27.verse: God created humankind in His image, in the image of God He created him, male and female He created them.

28.verse: God blessed them and God said to them, “Be fruitful and multiply, fill the land, and conquer it. Rule over the fish of the sea, the flying creatures of the sky, and over every animal that crawls on the land.”

29.verse: Then God said, “I have just given you every green plant yielding seed that is on the surface of the whole land, and every tree, which has the fruit of a tree yielding seed. They are to be food for you.

30.verse: Also for every wild animal, every flying creature of the sky and every creature that crawls on the land which has life, every green plant is to be food.” And it happened so.

31.verse: So God saw everything that He made, and behold it was very good. So there was evening and there was morning—the sixth day.

1.verse: Shabbat For Rest - So the heavens and the earth were completed along with their entire array.

2.verse: God completed—on the seventh day—His work that He made, and He ceased—on the seventh day—from all His work that He made.

3.verse: Then God blessed the seventh day and sanctified it, for on it He ceased from all His work that God created for the purpose of preparing.

4.verse: Humanity in Gan-Eden - These are the genealogical records of the heavens and the earth when they were created, at the time when ADONAI Elohim made land and sky.

5.verse: Now no shrub of the field was in the land yet, and no green plants of the field had sprouted yet. For ADONAI Elohim had not caused it to rain upon the land, and there was no one to work the ground.

6.verse: But a mist came up from the land and watered the whole surface of the ground.

7.verse: Then ADONAI Elohim formed the man out of the dust from the ground and He breathed into his nostrils a breath of life—so the man became a living being.

8.verse: Then ADONAI Elohim planted a garden in Eden in the east, and there He put the man whom He had formed.

9.verse: Then ADONAI Elohim caused to sprout from the ground every tree that was desirable to look at and good for food. Now the Tree of Life was in the middle of the garden, and also the Tree of Knowledge of Good and Evil.

10.verse: A river flowed out of Eden to water the garden. From there it divided and became four riverheads.

11.verse: The name of the first is Pishon, the one that winds around the whole land of the Havilah, where there is gold.

12.verse: The gold of that land is good—bdellium and lapis lazuli stones are also there.

13.verse: The name of the second river is Gihon—it winds around the whole land of Cush.

14.verse: The name of the third river is Tigris—it runs east of Assyria. And the fourth river is Euphrates.

15.verse: Then ADONAI Elohim took the man and gave him rest in the Garden of Eden in order to cultivate and watch over it.

16.verse: Then ADONAI Elohim commanded the man saying, “From all the trees of the garden you are most welcome to eat.

17.verse: But of the Tree of the Knowledge of Good and Evil you must not eat. For when you eat from it, you most assuredly will die!

18.verse: Then ADONAI Elohim said, “It is not good for the man to be alone. Let Me make a well-matched helper for him.”

19.verse: ADONAI Elohim had formed from the ground every animal of the field and every flying creature of the sky, so He brought them to the man to see what he would call them. Whatever the man called them—each living creature—that was its name.

20.verse: So the man gave names to all of the livestock, and to the flying creatures of the sky, and to all the animals of the field; but for the man He did not find a well-matched helper for him.

21.verse: ADONAI Elohim caused a deep sleep to fall on the man and he slept; and He took one of his ribs and closed up the flesh in its place.

22.verse: ADONAI Elohim built the rib, which He had taken from the man, into a woman. Then He brought her to the man.

23.verse: Then the man said, “This one, at last, is bone of my bones and flesh from my flesh. This one is called woman, for from man was taken this one.”

24.verse: This is why a man leaves his father and his mother and clings to his wife; and they become one flesh.

25.verse: From Innocence to Shame - Now both of them were naked, the man and his wife, and they were not ashamed.

1.verse: But the serpent was shrewder than any animal of the field that ADONAI Elohim made. So it said to the woman, “Did God really say, ‘You must not eat from all the trees of the garden’?”

2.verse: The woman said to the serpent, “Of the fruit of the trees, we may eat.

3.verse: But of the fruit of the tree which is in the middle of the garden, God said, ‘You must not eat of it and you must not touch it, or you will die.’”

4.verse: The serpent said to the woman, “You most assuredly won’t die!

5.verse: For God knows that when you eat of it, your eyes will be opened and you will be like God, knowing good and evil.”

6.verse: Now the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and that it was a thing of lust for the eyes, and that the tree was desirable for imparting wisdom. So she took of its fruit and she ate. She also gave to her husband who was with her and he ate.

7.verse: Then the eyes of both of them were opened and they knew that they were naked; so they sewed fig leaves together and made for themselves loin-coverings.

8.verse: And they heard the sound of ADONAI Elohim going to and fro in the garden in the wind of the day. So the man and his wife hid themselves from the presence of ADONAI Elohim in the midst of the Tree of the garden.

9.verse: Then ADONAI Elohim called to the man and He said to him, “Where are you?”

10.verse: Then he said, “Your sound—I heard it in the garden and I was afraid. Because I am naked, I hid myself.”

11.verse: Then He said, “Who told you that you are naked? Have you eaten from the Tree from which I commanded you not to eat?”

12.verse: Then the man said, “The woman whom You gave to be with me—she gave me of the Tree, and I ate.”

13.verse: ADONAI Elohim said to the woman, “What did you do?” The woman said, “The serpent deceived me and I ate.”

14.verse: ADONAI Elohim said to the serpent, “Because you did this, Cursed are you above all the livestock and above every animal of the field. On your belly will you go, and dust will you eat all the days of your life.

15.verse: I will put animosity between you and the woman— between your seed and her seed. He will crush your head, and you will crush his heel.

16.verse: To the woman He said, “I will greatly increase your pain from conception to labor. In pain will you give birth to children. Your desire will be toward your husband, yet he must rule over you.”

17.verse: Then to the man He said, “Because you listened to your wife’s voice and ate of the tree which I commanded you, saying, ‘You must not eat of it’: Cursed is the ground because of you— with pain will you eat of it all the days of your life.

18.verse: Thorns and thistles will sprout for you. You will eat the plants of the field,

19.verse: By the sweat of your brow will you eat food, until you return to the ground, since from it were you taken. For you are dust, and to dust will you return.”

20.verse: Now Adam named his wife Eve because she was the mother of all the living.

21.verse: ADONAI Elohim made Adam and his wife tunics of skin and He clothed them.

22.verse: Then ADONAI Elohim said, “Behold, the man has become like one of Us, knowing good and evil. So now, in case he stretches out his hand and takes also from the Tree of Life and eats and lives forever,”

23.verse: ADONAI Elohim sent him away from the Garden of Eden, to work the ground from which he had been taken.

24.verse: And He expelled the man; and at the east of the Garden of Eden He had cheruvim dwell along, with the whirling sword of flame, to guard the way to the Tree of Life.

1.verse: Cain and Abel’s Blood - Now the man had relations with Eve his wife and she became pregnant and gave birth to Cain. She said, “I produced a man with ADONAI.”

2.verse: Then she gave birth again, to his brother Abel. Abel became a shepherd of flocks while Cain became a worker of the ground.

3.verse: So it happened after some time that Cain brought an offering of the fruit of the ground to ADONAI,

4.verse: while Abel—he also brought of the firstborn of his flock and their fat portions. Now ADONAI looked favorably upon Abel and his offering,

5.verse: but upon Cain and his offering He did not look favorably. Cain became very angry, and his countenance fell.

6.verse: Then ADONAI said to Cain, “Why are you angry? And why has your countenance fallen?

7.verse: If you do well, it will lift. But if you do not do well, sin is crouching at the doorway. Its desire is for you, but you must master it.”

8.verse: Cain spoke to Abel his brother. While they were in the field, Cain rose up against Abel his brother and killed him.

9.verse: Then ADONAI said to Cain, “Where is Abel, your brother?” “I don’t know,” he said. “Am I my brother’s keeper?”

10.verse: Then He said, “What have you done? The voice of your brother’s blood is crying out to Me from the ground.

11.verse: So now, cursed are you from the ground which opened its mouth to receive your brother’s blood from your hand.

12.verse: As often as you work the ground, it will not yield its crops to you again. You will be a restless wanderer on the earth.”

13.verse: Cain said to ADONAI, “My iniquity is too great to bear!

14.verse: Since You expelled me today from the face of the ground and I must be hidden from Your presence, then I will be a restless wanderer on the earth—anyone who finds me will kill me!”

15.verse: But ADONAI said to him, “In that case, anyone who kills Cain is to be avenged seven times over.” So ADONAI put a mark on Cain, so that anyone who found him would not strike him down.

16.verse: Then Cain left ADONAI’s presence and dwelled in the Land of Wandering, east of Eden.

17.verse: Cain was intimate with his wife and she became pregnant and gave birth to Enoch. And he was building a city, and he named the city after the name of his son, Enoch.

18.verse: And to Enoch was born Irad. Irad fathered Mehujael, and Mehujael fathered Methushael, and Methushael fathered Lamech.

19.verse: Now Lamech took for himself two wives. The name of the first one was Adah, and the name of the second one was Zillah.

20.verse: Adah gave birth to Jabal—he was the pioneer of tent dwellers with livestock.

21.verse: His brother’s name was Jubal—he was the pioneer of all who skillfully handle stringed instruments and wind instruments.

22.verse: Now Zillah also gave birth to Tubal-Cain, the forger of every kind of bronze and iron tools; Tubal-Cain’s sister was Naamah.

23.verse: Lamech said to his wives, “Adah and Zillah: Hear my voice! Lamech’s wives: Listen to my speech! For I have killed a man for wounding me, and a boy for bruising me.

24.verse: If Cain is to be avenged seven times, then Lamech—77 times!”

25.verse: Adam was intimate with his wife again, and she gave birth to a son and she named him Seth, “For God has appointed me another seed in place of Abel—since Cain killed him.”

26.verse: To Seth, also was born a son. He named him Enosh. Then people began to call on ADONAI’s Name.

1.verse: Book of Genealogies - This is the Book of the Genealogies of Adam: When God created Adam, in the likeness of God He made him.

2.verse: Male and female He created them, and He blessed them and called their name “Adam” when He created them.

3.verse: Adam lived 130 years, then fathered a son in his likeness, after his image, and named him Seth.

4.verse: Then the days of Adam after he fathered Seth were 800 years, and He fathered other sons and daughters.

5.verse: So all Adam’s days that he lived were 930 years, and then he died.

6.verse: Seth lived 105 years, then fathered Enosh.

7.verse: Seth lived 807 years after he fathered Enosh, and he fathered sons and daughters.

8.verse: So all Seth’s days were 912 years, and then he died.

9.verse: Enosh lived 90 years, then fathered Kenan.

10.verse: Enosh lived 815 years after he fathered Kenan, and he fathered sons and daughters.

11.verse: So all of Enosh’s days were 905 years, and then he died.

12.verse: Kenan lived 70 years, then fathered Mahalalel.

13.verse: Kenan lived 840 years after he fathered Mahalalel, he fathered sons and daughters.

14.verse: So all of Kenan’s days were 910 years, and then he died.

15.verse: Mahalalel lived 65 years, then fathered Jared.

16.verse: Mahalalel lived 830 years after he fathered Jared, and he fathered sons and daughters.

17.verse: So all of Mahalalel’s days were 895 years, and then he died.

18.verse: Jared lived 162 years, then fathered Enoch.

19.verse: Jared lived 800 years after he fathered Enoch, and he fathered sons and daughters.

20.verse: So all of Jared’s days were 962 years, and then he died.

21.verse: Enoch lived 65 years, then fathered Methuselah.

22.verse: Now Enoch walked with God continually for 300 years after he fathered Methuselah, and he fathered sons and daughters.

23.verse: So all of Enoch’s days were 365 years.

24.verse: And Enoch continually walked with God—then he was not there, because God took him.

25.verse: Methuselah lived 187 years and fathered Lamech.

26.verse: And Methuselah lived 782 years after he fathered Lamech, and he fathered other sons and daughters.

27.verse: So all of Methuselah’s days were 969 years, and then he died.

28.verse: Lamech lived 182 years and he fathered a son.

29.verse: And he named him Noah saying, “This one will comfort us from our work and from the pain of our hands because of the ground which ADONAI cursed.”

30.verse: Lamech lived 595 years after he fathered Noah, and he fathered sons and daughters.

31.verse: So all of Lamech’s days were 777 years, and then he died.

32.verse: And Noah was 500 years old when he fathered Shem, Ham and Japheth.

1.verse: Evil Inclination of All Humanity - Now when humankind began to multiply on the face of the ground and daughters were born to them,

2.verse: then the sons of God saw that the daughters of men were good and they took for themselves wives, any they chose.

3.verse: Then ADONAI said, “My Spirit will not remain with humankind forever, since they are flesh. So their days will be 120 years.

4.verse: The Nephilim were on the earth in those days, and also afterward, whenever the sons of God came to the daughters of men, and gave birth to them. Those were the mighty men of old, men of renown.

5.verse: Then ADONAI saw that the wickedness of humankind was great on the earth, and that every inclination of the thoughts of their heart was only evil all the time.

6.verse: So ADONAI regretted that He made humankind on the earth, and His heart was deeply pained.

7.verse: So ADONAI said, “I will wipe out humankind, whom I have created, from the face of the ground, from humankind to livestock, crawling things and the flying creatures of the sky, because I regret that I made them.”

8.verse: But Noah found favor in ADONAI’s eyes.

9.verse: Parashat Noah - These are the genealogies of Noah. Noah was a righteous man. He was blameless among his generation. Noah continually walked with God.

10.verse: Noah fathered three sons: Shem, Ham and Japheth.

11.verse: Now the earth was ruined before God, and the earth was filled with violence.

12.verse: God saw the earth, and behold it was ruined because all flesh had corrupted their way upon the earth.

13.verse: Instructions for the Ark - Then God said to Noah, “The end of all flesh is coming before Me, for the earth is filled with violence because of them. Behold, I am about to bring ruin upon them along with the land.

14.verse: Make for yourself an ark of gopher wood. You shall make the ark with compartments and smear pitch on it, both inside and out.

15.verse: Now this is how you shall make it: the length of the ark 300 cubits, its breadth 50 cubits, and its height 30 cubits.

16.verse: You shall make a roof for the ark, and you shall finish it to within a cubit from the top. You shall put the door of the ark in its side. You shall make it with lower, second, and third stories.

17.verse: Now I am about to bring the flood—water upon the land—to destroy all flesh in which is the spirit of life from under the sky. Everything that is on the land will perish.

18.verse: But I will establish My covenant with you. So you shall come into the ark—you, your sons, your wife, and your sons’ wives with you.

19.verse: Also of every living thing, of all flesh, you shall bring two of everything—male and female—into the ark to keep alive with you.

20.verse: Of the flying creatures according to their kind, of the livestock according to their kind, of all the crawling creatures of the ground according to their kind—two of everything will come to you to keep them alive.

21.verse: As for you: take for yourself every kind of edible food and gather it to yourself. It will be food for you and for them.”

22.verse: So Noah did according to all that God commanded him; he did so exactly.

1.verse: Deliverance Through the Flood - Then ADONAI said to Noah, “Come—you and all your household—into the ark. For you only do I perceive as righteous before Me in this generation.

2.verse: Of every clean animal you shall take with you seven of each kind, male and female; and of the animals which themselves are not clean two, male and female;

3.verse: also of the flying creatures of the sky seven of every kind, male and female, to keep offspring alive on the face of the whole land.

4.verse: For in seven more days, I am going to make it rain upon the land forty days and forty nights, and I will wipe out all existence that I made from the face of the ground.

5.verse: So Noah did all just as ADONAI commanded him.

6.verse: Now Noah was 600 years old when the flood came—water upon the land.

7.verse: So Noah, his sons, his wife, and his sons’ wives, entered the ark because of the floodwaters.

8.verse: Of the clean animals and unclean animals, the flying creatures and everything that crawls on the ground,

9.verse: two by two they came to Noah, into the ark, male and female, just as God commanded Noah.

10.verse: After the seven days, the floodwaters were upon the land.

11.verse: In the six-hundredth year of Noah’s life, in the second month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on this day, all the water sources of the great deep burst open, and the windows of the sky were opened.

12.verse: Then there was rain upon the land 40 days and 40 nights.

13.verse: On that same day Noah, along with Noah’s sons Shem, Ham and Japheth, Noah’s wife and the three wives of Noah’s sons with them, entered the ark,

14.verse: they and every animal according to its kind, and all the livestock according to its kind, and every crawling creature that crawls on the land according to its kind, and every flying creature according to its kind, every bird, every winged creature.

15.verse: So to Noah and into the ark they went by twos—all flesh in which was the spirit of life.

16.verse: Those that came, male and female of all flesh, came just as God commanded him. Then ADONAI shut him in.

17.verse: The flood was forty days upon the land, and the waters increased and lifted the ark, so that it rose above the land.

18.verse: The waters overpowered and became very mighty over the land, and the ark drifted on the surface of the water.

19.verse: The waters completely overpowered the land so that all the high mountains beneath the entire sky were covered.

20.verse: The waters rose 15 cubits higher, as the mountains were covered.

21.verse: All flesh perished—those that crawl on the land, the flying creatures, livestock, wild animals, all creatures that swarm upon the land, and all humankind.

22.verse: Everything that had the breath of the spirit of life in its nostrils—everything on dry land—died.

23.verse: So He wiped out all existence that was upon the surface of the ground, everything from people to livestock, to crawling creatures, and to flying creatures of the sky. They were wiped out off the land. Only Noah and those with him in the ark survived.

24.verse: The waters overpowered the land for 150 days.

1.verse: Then God remembered Noah and all the wild animals and all the livestock that were with him in the ark. So God caused a wind to pass over the land and the water subsided.

2.verse: Also the sources of the deep and the windows of the skies were closed up, and the rain from the sky was held back.

3.verse: The waters kept receding gradually from upon the land and the waters decreased by the end of 150 days.

4.verse: The ark came to rest in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, upon the mountains of Ararat.

5.verse: The waters went on decreasing until the tenth month. In the tenth month, on the first day of the month, the tops of the mountains appeared.

6.verse: It was at the end of forty days that Noah opened the window of the ark that he had made.

7.verse: Then he sent out a raven and it kept going back and forth until the waters were drying up from the land.

8.verse: Then he sent out a dove to see whether the waters had receded from the surface of the ground.

9.verse: But the dove did not find a resting place for the sole of her foot. She returned to him in the ark because water covered the surface of the whole land. He stretched out his hand and he took her, and brought her to him into the ark.

10.verse: So he waited yet another seven days and again he sent the dove out from the ark.

11.verse: The dove came to him at evening, and surprisingly—a freshly plucked olive leaf was in its mouth. So Noah knew that the waters had receded from the land.

12.verse: After he waited seven more days, he sent out the dove, but she did not return to him again.

13.verse: It was in his six-hundred-and first year—in the first month, on the first day of the month—that the waters had dried up from the land. Then Noah removed the cover of the ark and he looked, and behold, the surface of the ground had dried up.

14.verse: By the second month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month, the land was dry.

15.verse: Noah’s Soothing Sacrifice - Then God spoke to Noah, saying,

16.verse: “Come out of the ark, you and your wife, your sons and your sons’ wives with you.

17.verse: Every animal that is with you of all flesh, including the flying creatures, livestock and every crawling creature that crawls on the land, bring out with you, and let them swarm in the land and be fruitful and multiply upon the land.”

18.verse: So Noah came out, with his sons, his wife, and his sons’ wives.

19.verse: Every animal—every crawling creature, every flying creature, everything that crawls upon the land—came out from the ark in their families.

20.verse: Then Noah built an altar to ADONAI and he took of every clean domestic animal and of every clean flying creature and he offered burnt offerings on the altar.

21.verse: When ADONAI smelled the soothing aroma, ADONAI said in His heart, “I will never again curse the ground on account of man, even though the inclination of the heart of humankind is evil from youth. Nor will I ever again smite all living creatures, as I have done.

22.verse: While all the days of the land remain, seedtime and harvest, cold and heat, summer and winter, day and night will not cease.”

1.verse: Covenant with Noah’s Descendants - God blessed Noah and his sons, and He said to them, “Be fruitful and multiply and fill the land.

2.verse: The fear and terror of you will be on every wild animal, and on every flying creature of the sky, with everything that crawls on the ground and with all the fish of the sea—into your hand they are given.

3.verse: Every crawling thing that is alive will be food for you, as are the green plants—I have now given you everything.

4.verse: Only flesh with its life—that is, its blood—you must not eat!

5.verse: Surely your lifeblood will I avenge. From every animal and from every person will I avenge it. From every person’s brother will I avenge that person’s life.

6.verse: The one who sheds human blood, by a human will his blood be shed, for in God’s image He made humanity.

7.verse: But as for you, be fruitful and multiply! Flourish in the land and multiply in it.”

8.verse: Then God said to Noah and to his sons with him, saying,

9.verse: “Now I, behold, I am about to establish My covenant with you, and with your seed after you,

10.verse: and with every living creature that is with you, including the flying creatures, the livestock, and every wild animal with you, of all that is coming out of the ark—every animal of the earth.

11.verse: I will confirm My covenant with you—never again will all flesh be cut off by the waters of the flood, and never again will there be a flood to ruin the land.”

12.verse: Then God said, “This is the sign of the covenant that I am making between Me and you, and every living creature that is with you for all future generations.

13.verse: My rainbow do I place in the cloud, and it will be a sign of the covenant between Me and the land.

14.verse: Whenever I bring clouds over the land and the rainbow appears in the clouds,

15.verse: I will remember My covenant that is between Me and you and every living creature of all flesh. Never again will the waters become a flood to destroy all flesh.

16.verse: When the rainbow is in the cloud, I will look at it, to remember the perpetual covenant between God and every living creature of all flesh that is on the land.”

17.verse: Then God said to Noah, “This is the sign of the covenant that I have confirmed between Me and all flesh that is on the land.”

18.verse: Dispersion of Noah’s Family - Noah’s sons who came out from the ark were Shem, Ham and Japheth, and Ham was the father of Canaan.

19.verse: These three were Noah’s sons, and from these the whole earth dispersed.

20.verse: Then Noah, a man of the soil, was first to plant a vineyard.

21.verse: He drank some of the wine, got drunk, and was uncovered in his tent.

22.verse: Then Ham, Canaan’s father, saw his father’s private parts and told his two brothers outside.

23.verse: So Shem and Japheth took the cloak and laid it over both their shoulders and walked backwards and with it covered their father’s private parts. But their faces were turned away, so they did not see their father’s private parts.

24.verse: When Noah woke up from his wine, he learned what his youngest son had done to him.

25.verse: So he said, “Cursed is Canaan: the lowest slave will he be to his brothers.”

26.verse: He also said, “Blessed be ADONAI, God of Shem, and let Canaan be his servant.

27.verse: May God enlarge Japheth, may he dwell in the tents of Shem, and may Canaan be his slave.”

28.verse: Now Noah lived 350 years after the flood.

29.verse: So all Noah’s days were 950 years. Then he died.

1.verse: And these are the genealogical records of Noah’s sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth. Sons were born to them after the flood.

2.verse: Japheth’s sons were Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech and Tiras.

3.verse: Gomer’s sons were Ashkenaz, Riphath and Togarmah.

4.verse: Javan’s sons were Elishah and Tarshish, Kittites and Dodanites.

5.verse: From these the coastlands of the nations spread out in their lands, each one according to his language, according to their families, into their nations.

6.verse: Ham’s sons were Cush, Mizraim, Put and Canaan.

7.verse: Cush’s sons were Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, and Sabteca. And Raamah’s sons were Sheba, and Dedan.

8.verse: Now Cush fathered Nimrod. He started to become mighty in the land.

9.verse: He was a mighty hunter before ADONAI. This is why it is said, “Like Nimrod, a mighty hunter before ADONAI.”

10.verse: The beginning of his kingdom included Babel, Erech, Accad and Calneh, in the land of Shinar.

11.verse: From that land he went out to Assyria and built Nineveh, Rechovot-ir, Calah

12.verse: and Resen, between Nineveh and Calah—it is the great city.

13.verse: Mizraim fathered the Ludites, the Anamites, the Lehabites, the Naphtuhites,

14.verse: the Pathrusites, the Casluhites—from whom came the Philistines—and the Caphtorites.

15.verse: Canaan fathered Sidon his firstborn, Heth,

16.verse: the Jebusite, the Amorite, the Girgashite,

17.verse: the Hivite, the Arkite, the Sinite,

18.verse: the Arvadite, the Zemarite and the Hamathite—and afterwards, the Canaanite families were scattered.

19.verse: Now the Canaanite border was from Zidon, as you go toward Gerar, as far as Gaza; as you go toward Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboiim, as far as Lasha.

20.verse: These are Ham’s sons according to their families, according to their languages, in their lands, in their nations.

21.verse: Sons were also born to Shem, who was Japheth’s older brother and the father of all the sons of Eber.

22.verse: Shem’s sons were Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud and Aram.

23.verse: Aram’s sons were Uz, Hul, Gether and Mash.

24.verse: Arpachshad fathered Shelah, and Shelah fathered Eber.

25.verse: Two sons were born to Eber. The name of the first was Peleg—because in his days the land was divided—and his brother’s name was Joktan.

26.verse: Joktan fathered Elmodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,

27.verse: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,

28.verse: Obal, Abimael, Sheba,

29.verse: Ophir, Havilah and Jobab. All of these are Joktan’s sons.

30.verse: Their dwelling place was from Mesha till you come toward Sephar, the eastern hill country.

31.verse: These are Shem’s sons, according to their families, according to their languages, in their lands, according to their nations.

32.verse: These are the families of the sons of Noah according to their genealogies in their nations, and from these the nations were dispersed on the earth after the flood.

1.verse: Tower of Babel - Now the entire earth had the same language with the same vocabulary.

2.verse: When they traveled eastward, they found a valley-plain in the land of Shinar and settled there.

3.verse: They said to one another, “Come! Let’s make bricks and bake them until they’re hard.” So they used bricks for stone, and tar for mortar.

4.verse: Then they said, “Come! Let’s build ourselves a city, with a tower whose top reaches into heaven. So let’s make a name for ourselves, or else we will be scattered over the face of the whole land.”

5.verse: Then ADONAI came down to see the city and the tower that the sons of man had built.

6.verse: ADONAI said, “Look, the people are one and all of them have the same language. So this is what they have begun to do. Now, nothing they plan to do will be impossible.

7.verse: Come! Let Us go down and confuse their language there, so that they will not understand each other’s language.”

8.verse: So ADONAI scattered them from there over the face of the entire land, and they stopped building the city.

9.verse: This is why it is named Babel, because ADONAI confused the languages of the entire world there, and from there ADONAI scattered them over the face of the entire world.

10.verse: From Shem to Abram - These are the genealogical records of Shem: Shem was 100 years old when he fathered Arpachshad—two years after the flood.

11.verse: Shem lived 500 years after he fathered Arpachshad, and he fathered sons and daughters.

12.verse: Arpachshad lived 35 years when he fathered Shelah.

13.verse: Arpachshad lived 403 years after he fathered Shelah, and fathered sons and daughters.

14.verse: Shelah lived 30 years and he fathered Eber.

15.verse: Shelah lived 403 years after he fathered Eber, and fathered sons and daughters.

16.verse: Eber lived 34 years and he fathered Peleg.

17.verse: Eber lived 430 years after he fathered Peleg, and he fathered sons and daughters.

18.verse: Peleg lived 30 years and he fathered Reu.

19.verse: Peleg lived 209 years after he fathered Reu, and he fathered sons and daughters.

20.verse: Reu lived 32 years and he fathered Serug.

21.verse: Reu lived 207 years after he fathered Serug, and he fathered sons and daughters.

22.verse: Serug lived 30 years and fathered Nahor.

23.verse: Serug lived 200 years after he fathered Nahor, and he fathered sons and daughters.

24.verse: Nahor lived 27 years and he fathered Terah.

25.verse: Nahor lived 119 years after he fathered Terah, and he fathered sons and daughters.

26.verse: Terah lived 70 years when he fathered Abram, Nahor and Haran.

27.verse: These are Terah’s genealogies: Terah fathered Abram, Nahor and Haran. Haran fathered Lot.

28.verse: Haran died before Terah his father, in the land of his birth, in Ur of the Chaldeans.

29.verse: Abram and Nahor took wives for themselves. The name of Abram’s wife was Sarai, and the name of Nahor’s wife was Milcah—the daughter of Haran, father of Milcah and Iscah.

30.verse: Sarai was barren; she did not have a child.

31.verse: Terah took Abram his son and Lot, Haran’s son, his grandson, and Sarai his daughter-in-law, his son Abram’s wife, and he took them out of Ur of the Chaldeans to go to the land of Canaan. But when they came to Haran, they settled there.

32.verse: Terah’s days were 205 years, and Terah died in Haran.

1.verse: Parashat Lech Lecha Abram Obeys the Calling - Then ADONAI said to Abram, “Get going out from your land, and from your relatives, and from your father’s house, to the land that I will show you.

2.verse: My heart’s desire is to make you into a great nation, to bless you, to make your name great so that you may be a blessing.

3.verse: My desire is to bless those who bless you, but whoever curses you I will curse, and in you all the families of the earth will be blessed.

4.verse: So Abram went, just as ADONAI had spoken to him. Also Lot went with him. (Now Abram was 75 years old when he departed from Haran.)

5.verse: Abram took Sarai his wife, and Lot his nephew, and all their possessions that they had acquired, and the people that they acquired in Haran, and they left to go to the land of Canaan, and they entered the land of Canaan.

6.verse: Abram passed through the land as far as the place of Shechem, as far as Moreh’s big tree. (The Canaanites were in the land then.)

7.verse: Then ADONAI appeared to Abram, and said, “I will give this land to your seed.” So there he built an altar to ADONAI, who had appeared to him.

8.verse: From there he moved to the mountain to the east of Beth-El and erected his tent (with Beth-El to the west and Ai to the east). There he built an altar to ADONAI and called on the Name of ADONAI.

9.verse: So Abram kept on journeying southward.

10.verse: Abram and Sarai in Egypt - Now there was a famine in the land. So Abram went down to Egypt to live as an outsider there, because the famine was severe in the land.

11.verse: Just as he was about to enter Egypt he said to Sarai his wife, “Look, please, I know that you are an attractive woman.

12.verse: So when the Egyptians see you they’ll say, ‘This is his wife.’ And they’ll kill me; but you, they’ll let live.

13.verse: Please say that you are my sister, so that I’ll be treated well for your sake, and my life will be spared because of you.”

14.verse: When Abram came to Egypt, the Egyptians did see that the woman was very beautiful.

15.verse: Indeed, Pharaoh’s officials saw her and they raved about her to Pharaoh. Then the woman was taken into Pharaoh’s house.

16.verse: But Abram was treated well for her sake, and he got sheep, cattle, male donkeys, male and female slaves, female donkeys and camels.

17.verse: But ADONAI struck Pharaoh and his household with great plagues because of Sarai, Abram’s wife.

18.verse: So Pharaoh called Abram and said, “What’s this that you did to me? Why didn’t you tell me that she is your wife?

19.verse: Why did you say, ‘She is my sister,’ so that I took her to be my wife? Now, here is your wife. Take—and go!”

20.verse: Then Pharaoh instructed men concerning him, and they expelled him, with his wife, and everything that belonged to him.

1.verse: So Abram went up from Egypt—he and his wife and everything that belonged to him, and Lot with him—to the Negev.

2.verse: Now Abram was very rich in livestock, silver and gold.

3.verse: He proceeded by stages from the Negev as far as Beth-El—to the place where his tent had been at the beginning, between Beth-El and Ai,

4.verse: to the place of the altar that he had made there at first, and there Abram called on the Name of ADONAI.

5.verse: Lot Separates From Abram - Now Lot, who was going with Abram, also had sheep and cattle and tents,

6.verse: so that the land could not support them living together, because their possessions were many, and they were not able to stay together.

7.verse: So there was a quarrel between the shepherds of Abram’s livestock and the shepherds of Lot’s livestock. (Now the Canaanites and the Perizzites were living in the land then.)

8.verse: So Abram said to Lot, “Please, let there be no strife between me and you, or between my shepherds and yours, since we are relatives.

9.verse: Isn’t the whole land before you? Please separate yourself from me. If to the left, then I’ll go to the right, and if to the right, then I’ll go to the left.”

10.verse: Lot lifted up his eyes and saw that the whole area surrounding the Jordan was well watered in its entirety (before ADONAI destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah)—like ADONAI’s garden, like the land of Egypt—till you come to Zoar.

11.verse: So Lot chose for himself the whole area surrounding the Jordan. Lot journeyed to the east, and they separated from each other.

12.verse: Abram dwelled in the land of Canaan, and Lot dwelled in the cities of the valley. And he moved his tent from place to place near Sodom.

13.verse: But the people of Sodom were evil—very great sinners against ADONAI.

14.verse: After Lot separated himself from him, ADONAI had said to Abram, “lift up your eyes, now, and look from the place where you are, to the north, south, east and west.

15.verse: For all the land that you are looking at, I will give to you and to your seed forever.

16.verse: I will make your seed like the dust of the earth so that if one could count the dust of the earth, then your seed could also be counted.

17.verse: Get up! Walk about the land through its length and width—for I will give it to you.”

18.verse: So Abram moved his tent from place to place, and came and dwelt by Mamre’s large trees, which are in Hebron, and there built an altar to ADONAI.

1.verse: Abram Rescues Lot - Now it came about in the days of Amraphel king of Shinar, Arioch king of Ellasar, Chedorlaomer king of Elam, and Tidal king of Goiim,

2.verse: that they made war with Bera king of Sodom, Birsha king of Gomorrah, Shinab king of Admah, Shemeber king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (this is Zoar).

3.verse: All of these kings joined forces in the Valley of the Siddim (this is the Salt Sea).

4.verse: For 12 years they had served Chedorlaomer, but in the thirteenth year they rebelled.

5.verse: In the fourteenth year Chedorlaomer came with the kings who were with him, and they defeated the Rephaim in Ashterot-karnaim, the Zuzim in Ham, and the Emim in Shaveh-kiryataim,

6.verse: and the Horites in the hill country of Seir as far as El-Paran, which is beside the wilderness.

7.verse: Then they came again to En-mishpat (this is Kadesh), and they subdued all the territory of the Amalekites, as well as the Amorites who live in Hazazon-tamar.

8.verse: Then the king of Sodom, the king of Gomorrah, the king of Admah, the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (this is Zoar) went out and lined themselves up for battle with them in the Valley of the Siddim,

9.verse: against Chedorlaomer king of Elam, Tidal king of Goiim, Amraphel king of Shinar, and Arioch king of Ellasar: four kings against five.

10.verse: Now the Valley of the Siddim was full of tar pits, and as the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah fled, they fell into them, and those who remained fled to the hills.

11.verse: So they took all of Sodom and Gomorrah’s possessions and their food and left.

12.verse: They also took Lot, Abram’s nephew, and his possessions, and they left (as he was living in Sodom).

13.verse: Then a survivor came and told Abram the Hebrew, who was dwelling by the large trees belonging to Mamre the Amorite, the brother of Eschol and the brother of Aner—they were Abram’s allies.

14.verse: When Abram heard that his kinsman had been taken captive, he rallied his trained men, those born in his household, 318 of them, and went in pursuit as far as Dan.

15.verse: Then he divided his servants against them at night, and he defeated them and pursued them as far as Hovah, which is north of Damascus.

16.verse: He brought back all the possessions, and also brought back his kinsman Lot and his possessions, as well as the women and the other people.

17.verse: Melech-Tzedek, King of Salem - Now after he returned from defeating Chedorlaomer and the kings who were with him, the king of Sodom went out to meet him in the Valley of Shaveh (this is the King’s Valley).

18.verse: Then Melchizedek, king of Salem, brought out bread and wine—he was a priest of El Elyon.

19.verse: He blessed him and said, “Blessed be Abram by El Elyon, Creator of heaven and earth,

20.verse: and blessed be El Elyon, Who gave over your enemies into your hand.” Then Abram gave him a tenth of everything.

21.verse: Then the king of Sodom said to Abram, “Give me the people—the possessions take for yourself.”

22.verse: But Abram said to the king of Sodom, “I raise my hand in oath to ADONAI, El Elyon, Creator of heaven and earth.

23.verse: Not a thread or even a sandal strap of all that is yours will I take, so you will not say, ‘I’ve made Abram rich!’

24.verse: I claim nothing but what the young men have eaten, and the share of the men who went with me—Aner, Eschol, and Mamre—let them take their share.”

1.verse: Cutting a Covenant - After these things the word of ADONAI came to Abram in a vision saying, “Do not fear, Abram. I am your shield, your very great reward.”

2.verse: But Abram said, “My Lord ADONAI, what will You give me, since I am living without children, and the heir of my household is Eliezer of Damascus?”

3.verse: Then Abram said, “Look! You have given me no seed, so a house-born servant is my heir.”

4.verse: Then behold, the word of ADONAI came to him saying, “This one will not be your heir, but in fact, one who will come from your own body will be your heir.

5.verse: He took him outside and said, “Look up now, at the sky, and count the stars—if you are able to count them.” Then He said to him, “So shall your seed be.”

6.verse: Then he believed in ADONAI and He reckoned it to him as righteousness.

7.verse: Then He said to him, “I am ADONAI who brought you out from Ur of the Chaldeans, in order to give you this land to inherit it.”

8.verse: So he said, “My Lord ADONAI, how will I know that I will inherit it?”

9.verse: Then He said to him, “Bring Me a three year old young cow, a three year old she-goat, a three year old ram, a turtle-dove and a young bird.”

10.verse: So he brought all these to Him and cut them in half, and put each piece opposite the other; but he did not cut the birds.

11.verse: Then birds of prey came down upon the carcasses, but Abram drove them away.

12.verse: When the sun was about to set and a deep sleep fell on Abram, behold, terror of great darkness was falling upon him!

13.verse: Then He said to Abram, “Know for certain that your seed will be strangers in a land that is not theirs, and they will be enslaved and oppressed 400 years.

14.verse: But I am going to judge the nation that they will serve. Afterward they will go out with many possessions.

15.verse: But you, you will come to your fathers in peace. You will be buried at a good old age.

16.verse: Then in the fourth generation they will return here—for the iniquity of the Amorites is not yet complete.”

17.verse: When the sun set and it became dark, behold, there was a smoking oven and a fiery torch that passed between these pieces.

18.verse: On that day ADONAI cut a covenant with Abram, saying, “I give this land to your seed, from the river of Egypt to the great river, the Euphrates River:

19.verse: the Kenite, the Kenizzites, the Kadmonites,

20.verse: the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Raphaites,

21.verse: the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Girgashites, and the Jebusites.”

1.verse: Hagar and Ishmael - Now Sarai, Abram’s wife, had not borne him children. But she had an Egyptian slave-girl—her name was Hagar.

2.verse: So Sarai said to Abram, “Look now, ADONAI has prevented me from having children. Go, please, to my slave-girl. Perhaps I’ll get a son by her.” Abram listened to Sarai’s voice.

3.verse: So Sarai, Abram’s wife, took her slave-girl Hagar the Egyptian—after Abram had lived ten years in the land of Canaan—and gave her to Abram her husband to be his wife.

4.verse: Then he went to Hagar and she became pregnant. When she saw that she was pregnant, in her eyes her mistress was belittled.

5.verse: So Sarai said to Abram, “The wrong done to me is because of you! I myself placed my slave-girl in your embrace. Now that she saw that she became pregnant, so in her eyes I am belittled. May ADONAI judge between you and me!”

6.verse: Abram said to Sarai, “Look! Your slave-girl is in your hand. Do to her what is good in your eyes.” So Sarai afflicted her, and she fled from her presence.

7.verse: Then the angel of ADONAI found her by the spring of water in the wilderness, next to the spring on the way to Shur.

8.verse: He said, “Hagar, Sarai’s slave-girl, where have you come from and where are you going?” She said, “I am fleeing from the presence of my mistress Sarai.”

9.verse: The angel of ADONAI said, “Return to your mistress and humble yourself under her hand.”

10.verse: Then the angel of ADONAI said to her, “I will bountifully multiply your seed, and they will be too many to count.”

11.verse: Then the angel of ADONAI said to her, Behold, you are pregnant and about to bear a son, and you shall name him Ishmael— for ADONAI has heard your affliction.

12.verse: He will be a wild donkey of a man. His hand will be against everyone, and everyone’s hand against him, and away from all his brothers will he dwell.

13.verse: So she called ADONAI who was speaking to her, “You are the God who sees me.” For she said, “Would I have gone here indeed looking for Him who looks after me?”

14.verse: That is why the well is named, the Well of the Living One Who Sees Me. (Behold, it is between Kadesh and Bered.)

15.verse: Then Hagar gave birth to a son for Abram, and Abram named his son, whom Hagar bore, Ishmael.

16.verse: Abram was 86 years old when Hagar gave birth to Ishmael for Abram.

1.verse: Covenant of Circumcision - When Abram was 99 years old, ADONAI appeared to Abram, and He said to him, “I am El Shaddai. Continually walk before Me and you will be blameless.

2.verse: My heart’s desire is to make My covenant between Me and you, and then I will multiply you exceedingly much.”

3.verse: Abram fell on his face, and God spoke with him, saying,

4.verse: “For My part, because My covenant is with you, you will be the father of a multitude of nations.

5.verse: No longer will your name be Abram, but your name will be Abraham, because I make you the father of a multitude of nations.

6.verse: Yes, I will make you exceedingly fruitful, and I will make you into nations, and kings will come forth from you.

7.verse: Yes, I will establish My covenant between Me and you and your seed after you throughout their generations for an everlasting covenant, in order to be your God and your seed’s God after you.

8.verse: I will give to you and to your seed after you the land where you are an outsider—the whole land of Canaan—as an everlasting possession, and I will be their God.”

9.verse: God also said to Abraham, “As for you, My covenant you must keep, you and your seed after you throughout their generations.

10.verse: This is My covenant that you must keep between Me and you and your seed after you: all your males must be circumcised.

11.verse: You must be circumcised in the flesh of your foreskin, and this will become a sign of the covenant between Me and you.

12.verse: Also your eight-day-olds must be circumcised, every male, throughout your generations, including a house-born slave or a slave bought with money from any foreigner who is not of your seed.

13.verse: Your house-born slave and your purchased slave must surely be circumcised. So My covenant will be in your flesh for an everlasting covenant.

14.verse: But the uncircumcised male who is not circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin—that person will be cut off from his people; he has broken My covenant.”

15.verse: God also said to Abraham, “As for Sarai your wife, you shall not call her by the name Sarai. Rather, Sarah is her name.

16.verse: And I will bless her, and moreover, I will give you a son from her. I will bless her and she will give rise to nations. Kings of the peoples will come from her.”

17.verse: Then Abraham fell on his face and laughed, and said to his heart, “Will a son be born to a 100-year-old man? Or will Sarah—who is 90 years old—give birth?”

18.verse: So Abraham said to God, “If only Ishmael might live before you!”

19.verse: But God said, “On the contrary, Sarah your wife will bear you a son and you must name him Isaac. So I will confirm My covenant with him as an everlasting covenant for his seed after him.

20.verse: As for Ishmael, I have heard you. See, I have blessed him and I will make him fruitful, and I will multiply him very very much. He will father twelve princes and I will make him a great nation.

21.verse: But My covenant will I establish with Isaac whom Sarah will bear to you at this set time next year.”

22.verse: When He finished speaking with him, God went up from Abraham.

23.verse: Then Abraham took Ishmael his son and all of his house-born slaves and all his purchased slaves—every male among the men of Abraham’s house—and he circumcised the flesh of their foreskin on this very same day, just as God had spoken with him.

24.verse: Abraham was 99 years old when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin,

25.verse: and his son Ishmael was 13 years old when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.

26.verse: On this very same day Abraham and Ishmael his son were circumcised.

27.verse: Also all the men of his house, house-born slaves and slaves purchased from a foreigner, were circumcised with him.

1.verse: Parashat Vayera The Promise of a Son - Then ADONAI appeared to him at Mamre’s large trees while he was sitting in the entrance of his tent during the heat of the day.

2.verse: When he lifted up his eyes to see, suddenly, three men were standing right by him. When he saw them, he ran from the entrance of his tent to meet them and bowed down to the ground.

3.verse: Then he said, “My Lord, if now I have found favor in your eyes, please do not pass by your servant.

4.verse: Please let a little water be brought so you can wash your feet, and make yourselves comfortable under the tree.

5.verse: And let me bring a bit of bread so that you can refresh yourselves—then you can pass on—since you have passed by your servant. They said, “Do just as you have said.”

6.verse: So Abraham hurried into the tent to Sarah and said, “Quick! Knead three measures of fine flour and prepare bread loaves!”

7.verse: Then to the herd Abraham ran and took a young ox, tender and good, and he gave it to the servant, who prepared it quickly.

8.verse: Then he took butter and milk and the young ox that he had prepared and set it before them. While he was standing by them under the tree, they ate.

9.verse: Then they said to him, “Where is Sarah your wife?” “There, in the tent,” he said.

10.verse: Then He said, “I will most surely return to you in about a year’s time, surprisingly, Sarah your wife will have a son.” Sarah was listening at the entrance of the tent, which was behind Him.

11.verse: Now Abraham and Sarah were old, advanced in years—Sarah had stopped having the way of women.

12.verse: So Sarah laughed to herself, saying, “After I’ve grown decrepit, can I have desire—and my lord so old?”

13.verse: Then ADONAI said to Abraham, “Why is it that Sarah laughed, saying, ‘Can I really give birth when I am so old?’

14.verse: Is anything too difficult for ADONAI? At the appointed time I will return to you—in about a year—and Sarah will have a son.”

15.verse: Sarah denied it saying, “I didn’t laugh!” For she was afraid. But He said, “No—for you did laugh.”

16.verse: Abraham Intercedes - Then the men got up from there and looked down over Sodom. Abraham was walking with them to send them off,

17.verse: when ADONAI said, “Should I keep secret from Abraham what I am about to do,

18.verse: seeing that Abraham will most certainly become a great and mighty nation and in him all the nations of the earth will be blessed?

19.verse: For I have made myself known to him so that he will command his sons and his household after him to keep the way of ADONAI by doing righteousness and justice, so that ADONAI may bring upon Abraham what He has spoken about him.”

20.verse: Then ADONAI said, “The outcry against Sodom and Gomorrah is great indeed, and their sin is very grievous indeed.

21.verse: I want to go down now, and see if they deserve destruction, as its outcry has come to Me. And if not, I will know.”

22.verse: Then the men turned from there and went toward Sodom, but Abraham was still standing before ADONAI.

23.verse: Abraham drew near and said, “Will you really sweep away the righteous with the wicked?

24.verse: Suppose there are fifty righteous within the city. Will you really sweep away and not spare the place for the sake of fifty righteous who are in it?

25.verse: Far be it from You to do such a thing—to cause the righteous to die with the wicked, so that the righteous and the wicked share the same fate! Far be it from You! Shall the Judge of the whole world not exercise justice?”

26.verse: Then ADONAI said, “If I find in Sodom fifty righteous people within the city, I will spare the whole place for their sake.”

27.verse: Then Abraham answered and said, “Look, pray, I have decided to speak to my Lord, though I am dust and ashes.

28.verse: Suppose the fifty righteous people are lacking five. Will You destroy the whole city for lack of five?” And He said, “I will not destroy it if I find forty-five there.”

29.verse: So he spoke to Him yet again and said, “Perhaps forty will be found there?” And He said, “I will not do it for the sake of the forty.”

30.verse: Then he said, “Please, let my Lord not be angry, so I may speak. Perhaps thirty will be found there?” And He said, “I will not do it if I find thirty there.”

31.verse: Then he said, “Look, pray, I have decided to speak to my Lord: Perhaps twenty will be found there?” And He said, “I will not destroy it for the sake of the twenty.”

32.verse: Then he said, “Please, let not my Lord be angry, so I may speak once more. Perhaps ten will be found there?” And He said, “I will not destroy it for the sake of the ten.”

33.verse: Now when He had finished speaking to Abraham, ADONAI left, and Abraham returned to his place.

1.verse: Sodom and Gomorrah - Now the two angels came to Sodom in the evening, while Lot was sitting at the gate of Sodom. When Lot saw them, he got up to meet them, and bowed down with his face to the ground.

2.verse: Then he said, “Here, please my lords, please turn aside to your servant’s house, spend the night and wash your feet. Then you can get up early and go on your way.” But they said, “No. We will spend the night in the open plaza.”

3.verse: But he urged them strongly, so they turned aside to him and they came into his house. He prepared a feast for them and baked matzot, and they ate.

4.verse: They had not yet lain down when the men of the city (the men of Sodom) surrounded the house—from youth to elderly, all the people without exception.

5.verse: And they called out to Lot and said to him, “Where are the men who came to you tonight? Bring them out to us so that we can have relations with them!”

6.verse: But Lot went out to them at the doorway and shut the door behind him,

7.verse: and said, “Please, my brothers, don’t act wickedly.

8.verse: Look, I have two daughters who haven’t been intimate with a man. Please let me bring them out to you—do to them whatever is good in your eyes! However, do nothing to these men—since they have come under the protection of my roof.”

9.verse: “Get out of the way!” they said, and they said, “This one came as an outsider and dares to judge! Now we’ll treat you worse than them!” So they strongly pressed against the man, Lot, and moved in close to break the door down.

10.verse: But the men reached out their hands, brought Lot into the house with them, and shut the door.

11.verse: Then they struck the men at the doorway of the house with blindness—from youth to elderly—so that they gave up trying to find the doorway.

12.verse: Then the men said to Lot, “Who else related to you is still here? A son-in-law, your sons and your daughters, whoever else is related to you in the city—bring them out of the place!

13.verse: For we are about to destroy this place, because their outcry has become so great before ADONAI that ADONAI has sent us to destroy it.”

14.verse: So Lot went out and spoke to his sons-in-law who were going to marry his daughters, “Get up!” he said, “Get out of this place! For ADONAI is about to destroy the city!” But in the eyes of his sons-in-law, he was like a joker.

15.verse: So when morning dawned the angels rushed Lot, saying, “Get up! Take your wife and your two daughters who are here, or else you will be swept away with the city’s iniquity!”

16.verse: But he hesitated. So the men grabbed his hand, his wife’s hand and his two daughters’ hands—because of ADONAI’s compassion for him—and they brought him out and left him outside the city.

17.verse: When they brought them outside, one said, “Flee for your life! Do not look behind you, and do not stop anywhere in the surrounding area! Escape to the hills, or else you’ll be swept away!”

18.verse: But Lot said to them, “No, my Lord, please!

19.verse: Look, please, your servant has found favor in Your eyes and You have magnified Your merciful loyalty, which You have shown me by letting me live. But I can’t escape to the hill country—for the disaster will overtake me and I’ll die!

20.verse: Look, please, this city is close enough to flee there, and it’s little. Please let me escape there. Isn’t it small? And let me live!”

21.verse: So He said to him, “Behold, I will grant your request concerning this matter too—not to demolish the city of which you have spoken.

22.verse: Hurry! Flee to safety there, because I cannot do anything until you arrive there.” (This is why the town is named Zoar.)

23.verse: The moment the sun rose upon the land, Lot entered Zoar,

24.verse: and ADONAI rained sulfur and fire upon Sodom and Gomorrah from ADONAI out of the sky.

25.verse: So He demolished these cities and the whole surrounding area, all the inhabitants of the cities and the vegetation of the ground.

26.verse: But his wife looked behind him and she turned into a pillar of salt.

27.verse: Now Abraham rose early in the morning to the place where he had stood before ADONAI,

28.verse: and he looked down toward Sodom and Gomorrah, and toward the entire land of the surrounding area, and saw, behold, the smoke of the land ascended like smoke from a furnace.

29.verse: So it was, as God destroyed the cities of the surrounding area, that God remembered Abraham, and sent Lot out of the midst of the upheaval, when He demolished the cities where Lot had dwelt.

30.verse: Lot Fathers Moab and Ammon - Then Lot went up from Zoar and dwelled on the mountain, his two daughters with him, because he was afraid to dwell in Zoar. So he lived in a cave—he and his two daughters.

31.verse: Then the firstborn said to the younger, “Our father is old, and there is no man in the land to come to us as is the custom of the whole land.

32.verse: Come on! Let’s make our father drink wine so that we can lie with him and keep the seed from our father alive.

33.verse: So they made their father drink wine that night, and the firstborn came and lay down with her father. Yet he did not know that she lay down and got up.

34.verse: On the following day, the firstborn said to the younger, “See! I slept with my father last night. Let’s make him drink wine tonight as well. Come on! Sleep with him so that we’ll keep the seed from our father alive.”

35.verse: So they made their father drink wine that night as well, and the younger got up and lay down with him and he did not know that she lay down and got up.

36.verse: So Lot’s two daughters become pregnant by their father.

37.verse: Then the firstborn gave birth to a son and named him Moab: he is the ancestor of the Moabites to this day.

38.verse: The younger also gave birth to a son and named him Ben-Ammi: he is the ancestor of the sons of Ammon to this day.

1.verse: Sarah Renewed - Then Abraham journeyed from there to the land of the Negev and settled between Kadesh and Shur. While he was dwelling as an outsider in Gerar,

2.verse: Abraham said of Sarah his wife, “She is my sister.” So King Abimelech of Gerar sent for and took Sarah.

3.verse: But God came to Abimelech in a dream at night and said to him, “Behold, you are as good as dead, because of the woman whom you have taken—since she is a married woman.”

4.verse: Now Abimelech had not come near her. So he said, “My Lord, will You slay a nation, even though innocent?

5.verse: Didn’t he say to me, ‘She’s my sister’? And she herself even said, ‘He’s my brother.’ I did this with integrity of my heart and guiltlessness of my hands.”

6.verse: Then God said to him in a dream, “Yes, I myself knew that you did this with integrity of your heart, so I, yes I Myself prevented you from sinning against Me. That is why I did not allow you to touch her.

7.verse: So now, return the man’s wife, for he is a prophet. And let him pray for you and you will live. But if you do not return her, know that you will surely die—you and all who are yours.”

8.verse: Abimelech rose early in the morning, called all his servants and spoke all these words in their ears—and the men were very frightened.

9.verse: Then Abimelech called to Abraham and said to him, “What have you done to us, and how have I sinned against you, that you brought great sin upon me and my kingdom? You’ve done to me things that should not be done!”

10.verse: Abimelech also said to Abraham, “What motivated you to do this thing?”

11.verse: Abraham said, “Because I thought, ‘There is certainly no fear of God in this place, so they’ll kill me, because of my wife.’

12.verse: And besides, she really is my sister. She’s my father’s daughter, though not my mother’s daughter. Then she became my wife.

13.verse: So when God made me wander away from my father’s house, I said to her, ‘This is your loyalty that you must show me: in every place we go, say of me, ‘He is my brother.’”

14.verse: Then Abimelech took sheep, cattle, male slaves and female slaves and gave them to Abraham, and returned his wife Sarah to him.

15.verse: Then Abimelech said, “Look, my land is before you. Dwell wherever it pleases you.”

16.verse: At the same time he said to Sarah, “Look, I’ve given a thousand shekels to your brother. Look, it is compensation for everything that happened—so to everyone with you, you are vindicated.”

17.verse: Then Abraham prayed to God and God healed Abimelech, his wife and his female slaves so that they could bear children.

18.verse: For ADONAI had completely locked up every womb in Abimelech’s household because of Sarah, Abraham’s wife.

1.verse: Birth of Isaac - Then ADONAI visited Sarah just as He had said, and ADONAI did for Sarah just as He had spoken.

2.verse: So Sarah became pregnant and gave birth to a son for Abraham in his old age, at the appointed time that God had told him.

3.verse: Abraham named his son who was born to him—whom Sarah bore for him—Isaac.

4.verse: Then Abraham circumcised Isaac, his eight-day-old son, just as God had commanded him.

5.verse: Abraham was 100 years old when Isaac his son was born to him.

6.verse: So Sarah said, “God has made laughter for me! Everyone who hears will laugh with me.”

7.verse: She also said, “Who would have said to Abraham, ‘Sarah has nursed children’? For I have given birth to a son in his old age!”

8.verse: Ishmael Banished, Yet Delivered - The child grew and was weaned—Abraham made a big feast on the day Isaac was weaned.

9.verse: But Sarah saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian whom she had born to Abraham—making fun.

10.verse: So she said to Abraham, “Drive out this female slave and her son, for the son of this female slave will not be an heir with my son—with Isaac.”

11.verse: Now the matter was very displeasing in Abraham’s eyes on account of his son.

12.verse: But God said to Abraham, “Do not be displeased about the boy and your slave woman. Whatever Sarah says to you, listen to her voice. For through Isaac shall your seed be called.

13.verse: Yet I will also make the son of the slave woman into a nation, because he is your seed.”

14.verse: So Abraham got up early in the morning and took bread and a skin of water and gave them to Hagar, putting them on her shoulder, and the child, and sent her away. She went and wandered about in the wilderness of Beer-sheba.

15.verse: When the water from the skin was finished, she abandoned the child under one of the bushes.

16.verse: Then she went and sat herself down opposite, about a bowshot away, for she had said, “I can’t bear to see the child dying!” So she sat down opposite and lifted up her voice and wept.

17.verse: Then God heard the boy’s voice and the angel of God called to Hagar from heaven, and He said to her, “What troubles you, Hagar? Do not be afraid, because God has heard the boy’s voice where he is.

18.verse: Get up! Lift the boy up, and hold on to him with your hand, for I will make him a great nation.”

19.verse: Then God opened her eyes and she saw a well of water, and she went and filled the water skin, and gave the boy a drink.

20.verse: God was with the boy and he grew. He dwelled in the wilderness and became an archer.

21.verse: He dwelled in the wilderness of Paran, and his mother took a wife for him from the land of Egypt.

22.verse: Covenant of Abimelech and Abraham - Now it came about at that same time that Abimelech—with Phicol the commander of his army—said to Abraham, “God is with you in all that you do.

23.verse: So now, make a pledge to me here, by God, that you will not violate your word with me or with my descendants or with my offspring. As I have shown loyalty to you, show the same to me, and to the land in which you have lived as an outsider.”

24.verse: Abraham said, “I make a pledge.”

25.verse: Now Abraham had rebuked Abimelech because of the well of water that Abimelech’s servants had seized.

26.verse: So Abimelech said, “I don’t know who did this thing. Nor did you tell me, nor did I hear about it until today.”

27.verse: Then Abraham took a flock of sheep and cattle and gave them to Abimelech, and the two of them made a covenant.

28.verse: Abraham set seven young ewe-lambs apart from the flock of sheep by themselves.

29.verse: Abimelech said to Abraham, “What do these seven ewe-lambs that you’ve set by themselves mean?”

30.verse: He said, “You are to accept the seven ewe-lambs from my hand, so that they may be a witness for me that I dug this well.”

31.verse: That is why that place is named Beer-sheba, because there both of them made a pledge,

32.verse: and they made a covenant in Beer-sheba. Then Abimelech got up, with Phicol the commander of his army, and they returned to the land of the Philistines.

33.verse: Then he planted a tamarisk tree in Beer-sheba and called there on the Name of ADONAI, the Everlasting God.

34.verse: He lived as an outsider in the land of the Philistines for many days.

1.verse: The Binding of Isaac - Now it was after these things that God tested Abraham. He said to him, “Abraham.” “Hineni,” he said.

2.verse: Then He said, “Take your son, your only son whom you love—Isaac—and go to the land of Moriah, and offer him there as a burnt offering on one of the mountains about which I will tell you.”

3.verse: So Abraham got up early in the morning, saddled his donkey and took two of his young men with him, and Isaac his son. He split wood for the burnt offering, and got up and went to the place about which God had told him.

4.verse: On the third day, Abraham lifted up his eyes and saw the place from a distance.

5.verse: Abraham said to his young men, “Sit yourselves down here with the donkey. As for me and the young man, we’ll go over there, worship and return to you.”

6.verse: Then Abraham took the wood for the burnt offering and put it on Isaac his son. In his hand he took the fire and the knife. So the two of them walked on together.

7.verse: Then Isaac said to Abraham his father, “My father?” Then he said, “Here I am, my son.” He said, “Look. Here’s the fire and the wood. But where’s the lamb for a burnt offering?”

8.verse: Abraham said, “God will provide for Himself a lamb for a burnt offering, my son.” The two of them walked on together.

9.verse: Then they came to the place about which God had told him, and Abraham built the altar there, laid out the wood, bound up Isaac his son, and laid him on the altar, on top of the wood.

10.verse: Then Abraham reached out his hand and took the knife to slaughter his son.

11.verse: But the angel of ADONAI called to him from heaven and said, “Abraham! Abraham!” He said, “Hineni!”

12.verse: Then He said, “Do not reach out your hand against the young man—do nothing to him at all. For now I know that you are one who fears God—you did not withhold your son, your only son, from Me.”

13.verse: Then Abraham lifted up his eyes and behold, there was a ram, just caught in the thick bushes by its horns. So Abraham went and took the ram, and offered it up as a burnt offering instead of his son.

14.verse: Abraham named that place, ADONAI Yireh,—as it is said today, “On the mountain, ADONAI will provide.”

15.verse: The angel of ADONAI called to Abraham a second time from heaven

16.verse: and said, “By myself I swear—it is a declaration of ADONAI—because you have done this thing, and you did not withhold your son, your only son,

17.verse: I will richly bless you and bountifully multiply your seed like the stars of heaven, and like the sand that is on the seashore, and your seed will possess the gate of his enemies.

18.verse: In your seed all the nations of the earth will be blessed—because you obeyed My voice.”

19.verse: Then Abraham returned to his young men and they got up and went together to Beer-sheba. Then Abraham dwelled in Beer-sheba.

20.verse: Now it was after these things that it was told to Abraham, “Look, Milcah has also borne sons to Nahor your brother:

21.verse: Uz his firstborn, Buz his brother, Kemuel the father of Aram,

22.verse: Chesed, Hazo, Pildash, Yidlaph and Bethuel.”

23.verse: Then Bethuel fathered Rebekah. These eight Milcah bore to Nahor, Abraham’s brother.

24.verse: His concubine, whose name was Reumah, also bore Tebah, Gaham, Tahash and Maacah.

1.verse: Parashat Chayei Sarah Abraham Purchases Machpelah - Now Sarah’s life was 127 years—the years of Sarah’s life.

2.verse: Sarah died in Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron), in the land of Canaan. Abraham came to mourn for Sarah and to weep over her.

3.verse: Then Abraham rose from before his dead one and spoke to the sons of Heth saying,

4.verse: “I am an outsider and a sojourner among you. Give me a gravesite among you so that I may bury my dead from before my presence.”

5.verse: The sons of Heth answered Abraham, saying to him,

6.verse: “Listen to us, my lord. You are a prince of God among us. Bury your dead in the best of our graves. None among us will withhold his grave from you, to bury your dead one.”

7.verse: Then Abraham got up and bowed down to the people of the land, to the sons of Heth,

8.verse: and spoke with them saying, “If you are of a mind to let me bury my dead from before my presence, listen to me. Plead with Ephron son of Zophar on my behalf,

9.verse: that he may give me the cave of Machpelah that belongs to him, that is at the end of his field. At the full price let him give it to me in your midst for a gravesite.”

10.verse: Now Ephron was sitting in the midst of the sons of Heth. And Ephron the Hittite answered Abraham in the ears of the sons of Heth, all those who enter the gate of his city, saying,

11.verse: “No, my lord, listen to me. The field—I hereby give it to you. Also the cave that is in it—I hereby give it to you. In the eyes of the sons of my people, I hereby give it to you. Bury your dead one.”

12.verse: Then Abraham bowed down before the people of the land,

13.verse: and spoke to Ephron in the ears of the people of the land saying, “But if only you would please listen to me. I hereby give the price of the field. Accept it from me that I may bury my dead one there.”

14.verse: So Ephron answered Abraham, saying to him,

15.verse: “My lord, listen to me. A land worth 400 shekels of silver—what is that between me and you? Bury your dead one.”

16.verse: Abraham heard Ephron. So Abraham weighed out to Ephron the silver that he had spoken of in the ears of the sons of Heth—400 shekels of silver at the merchant’s rate.

17.verse: Now Ephron’s field that is in Machpelah next to Mamre—the field and the cave that is in it, and all the trees that are in the field in all its surrounding territory—was handed over

18.verse: to Abraham as a purchased possession in the eyes of the sons of Heth, before all those who enter the gate of his city.

19.verse: Afterward, Abraham buried Sarah his wife in the cave of the field of Machpelah next to Mamre (that is, Hebron), in the land of Canaan.

20.verse: So the field and the cave that was in it were handed over to Abraham as a gravesite from the sons of Heth.

1.verse: Courting of Rebekah - Now Abraham was old, advanced in years, and ADONAI blessed Abraham in everything.

2.verse: Then Abraham said to his servant, the oldest of his household who managed everything that belonged to him, “Now put your hand under my thigh,

3.verse: so that I may make you take an oath by ADONAI, the God of heaven and the God of earth, that you will not take a wife for my son from among the daughters of the Canaanites among whom I am dwelling.

4.verse: On the contrary, to my land and to my relatives you must go and get a wife for my son Isaac.

5.verse: But the servant said to him, “Suppose the woman were unwilling to follow after me to this land? Should I then have your son go back to the land you came from?

6.verse: Abraham said to him, “See to it that you don’t return my son there.

7.verse: ADONAI, the God of heaven, who took me from my father’s house and from my native land and who spoke to me and made a pledge to me saying, ‘To your seed I will give this land’—He will send His angel before you and you will take a wife for my son from there.

8.verse: If the woman is not willing to follow after you, then you will be free from this oath of mine. Nevertheless, you must not return my son there.”

9.verse: So the servant put his hand under the thigh of Abraham his master, and he made a pledge to him concerning this matter.

10.verse: Then the servant took ten of his master’s camels and left with all the best of his master’s things in his hand. Then he arose and went to Aram-Naharaim, to Nahor’s city.

11.verse: Then he made the camels kneel down outside the city by the well of water at evening time, the time for the going out to draw water.

12.verse: “ADONAI, the God of Abraham my master,” he said, “please make something happen before me today, and show loyalty to Abraham my master.

13.verse: Look, I am standing by the spring of water, and the daughters of the men of the city are going out to draw water.
